Hello @jorisvandenbossche! Thanks for submitting the PR.

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/indexes/interval.py`](https://github.com/jorisvandenbossche/pandas/blob/ec88f66c9daf8b2f3e0688886d4e803b9ebd1ea3/pandas/core/indexes/interval.py) !

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24134?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [c0b9eea...f95ae76](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24134?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

I'll look into this later today.

It seems that we're now hitting the else in https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/c91115172ce1e7324ff9422cb38f520496df2573/pandas/io/formats/format.py#L933-L939.
Updated to pass through a `leading_space` argument and tests for the formatters that we removed.

> this is happing because IntervalIndex and Series[Interval] are now both using GenericArrayFormatter to format the values. Series need a leading space, but indexes don't. 

I don't really know the formatting code, but would it make sense to move this "adding a leading space or not" to the code that actually combines the list of strings into the actual repr? As it is only when concatting them with ',' in the middle for the Index repr that you need those spaces? 
(just wondering, not for this PR, but might be an idea to clean this up)

I'm not too familiar with it either, but that seems sensible to me. It'd be
nice to focus the array formatter on formatting
the values, and a higher-level formatter for joining together those
formatted arrays.

On Mon, Dec 10, 2018 at 6:02 PM Joris Van den Bossche <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> this is happing because IntervalIndex and Series[Interval] are now both
> using GenericArrayFormatter to format the values. Series need a leading
> space, but indexes don't.
>
> I don't really know the formatting code, but would it make sense to move
> this "adding a leading space or not" to the code that actually combines the
> list of strings into the actual repr? As it is only when concatting them
> with ',' in the middle for the Index repr that you need those spaces?
> (just wondering, not for this PR, but might be an idea to clean this up)

ok, merging this though @TomAugspurger can you open an issue on https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24134#issuecomment-446054175 which sounds good.
